topic: Eurostar has just launched a massive sale with 25 percent off tickets to Paris and Amsterdam

ideas.title: Baguette Boarding Pass
ideas.premise: A Parisian commuter tries to use a baguette as a boarding pass at the Eurostar terminal, arguing it's '25% off bread, 25% off travel!'
ideas.why_funny: Absurd connection between the sale and everyday Parisian life; wordplay.

ideas.title: The Great Escape (to Amsterdam)
ideas.premise: A group of mime artists, dressed in berets, are discreetly Eurostar-ing to Amsterdam to escape the overwhelming tourism in Paris.
ideas.why_funny: Parisian stereotype meets escape; Amsterdam is the punchline.

ideas.title: Eiffel Tower's Midlife Crisis
ideas.premise: The Eiffel Tower, visibly depressed, complains to a Seine River boat about how everyone's ditching Paris for Amsterdam because of the Eurostar sale.
ideas.why_funny: Anthropomorphism of a landmark; relatable feeling of being overshadowed.

ideas.title: Snail Mail Slowdown
ideas.premise: A snail mail delivery worker, drowning in postcards to Amsterdam, laments the Eurostar sale and the decline of his profession.
ideas.why_funny: Old vs. new; the snail's perspective on modern travel.

ideas.title: Lost in Translation (Savings)
ideas.premise: Two tourists in Paris misunderstand '25% off' and try to pay only a quarter for everything, causing chaos at a cafe.
ideas.why_funny: Tourist misunderstanding of French culture and the sale offer.
